paper_abstract: Registration of pre- and intra-interventional data is one of the key technologies for image-guided radiation therapy, radiosurgery, minimally invasive surgery, endoscopy, and interventional radiology. In this paper, we survey those 3D/2D data registration methods that utilize 3D computer tomography or magnetic resonance images as the pre-interventional data and 2D X-ray projection images as the intra-interventional data. The 3D/2D registration methods are reviewed with respect to image modality, image,dimensionality, registration basis, geometric transformation, user interaction, optimization procedure, subject, and object of registration. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A review of 3D/2D registration methods for image-guided interventions
